name: rizzle
text: beef is true blue

name: afrothunder
text: So much so that he instinctively knows that Ray went straight to hell.

name: zem
text: Rose is apparently pretty on the ball

name: wehavemagnums
text: I was just thinking that.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Yeah, she seems a pretty perceptive kind of lady. She must have felt pretty scared when Beef hung up on her.

name: d-pad
text: I imagine she wasn't scared, simply curious. All like, "Well, I hope he calls back, but if not, at least I know the answer to this for future reference."

name: jonmw
text: I bet that she ALSO made an entry about Tofutti-Cuties in their database too. Mid-conversation.

name: spinynorman
text:
She's related to the Playboy advisor.

In Achewood, mundane coporate institutions, from Playboy, to Butterball, to Heinz and the generic Mexican Magical Realism Factory, all have fantastic knowledge and abilities. I really like this dimension. It makes me think of that string of Stephen King short stories about the New York club where old lawyers would sit and drink and tell bizarre and terrifying stories from their past.

name: ford
text: Does anyone know what these stories are called? they sound interesting

name: dougthehead
text: I think it was actually a novella in "Different Seasons," one of King's best collections- it contained "The Shawshank Redemption," "Apt Pupil," and "The Body" (which was later made into the movie "Stand by Me") as well as the aforementioned story of lawyers telling tales in a club in New York.

name: ford
text: I actually read Different Seasons and vaguely remember this now. [pedantry]The first one was actually called "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redeption.[/pedantry] I may have to reread the one about the lawyers.

name: belgand
text: It was indeed an excellent collection and it contained, in order: "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption", "Apt Pupil", "The Body",and the only one not made into a film and which likely never will be, "The Breathing Method". Each was also linked to a season: "Hope Springs Eternal", "Summer of Corruption", "Fall From Innocence", and "A Winter's Tale". I forgot the framing device used, but this was also (according to Wikipedia) used in "The Man Who Would Not Shake Hands". Overall the story was somewhat interesting, but not up to the caliber of the other stories and relied entirely on it's simple gimmick. It would have worked much better as a shorter story.

name: ford
text: dude when did "Apt Pupil" get turned into a movie? that story is hella creepy .

name: spinynorman
text:
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118636/

1998, it seems. It features Gandalf as the horrible Nazi. (Which is different from the lovable Nazis like Sgt. Schultz from Hogan's Heroes.)

name: mystkmanat
text: YES!  The set up was very cool (with the lawyers), but the actual story was really nothing special to me.  Nazis, daring prison escapes, and childhood friendships will always be more interesting to me than cheap ghost stories.

name: apocowarg
text: "The Breathing Method" was adapted into a TV movie, I believe.

name: belgand
text: Damn. I have no idea how that would work. I mean, there just isn't enough to the story and even in the end it's not a really great one. It's been a while since I read it, but I see no reason to.

name: spinynorman
text: It does seem absurd.

name: apocowarg
text: I did a little research and it has been announced as a project that one of the producers of the Friday the 13th remake is working on. There's no other names attached at this time so it may never see the light. I agree that the story as is can't support a film, it was probably purchased due to the sucess of the other stories.

name: apocowarg
text: *success

name: luckypyjamas
text: pretty on the butter ball

name: zem
text: either get a strike or strike out gutter ball

name: wulvaine
text: I was going to say it if nobody else had. Although I would have expected lames for the sheer awfulness of the pun.

name: luckypyjamas
text: you know, i expected to get lamed, but it totally would have been worth it

name: wildcat
text: oh, snap.

name: rykan
text:
Yeah, the butter ball!

I'll get my coat.

name: nice-on-water
text: exactly

name: rayonatoilet
text: Rose seems to understand Beef a little too perfectly. I worry sometimes that he chose the wrong lady.

name: dusty
text: Opposites don't attract, but people who are exactly the same really don't work. Beef and Rose would spiral into depression together. And me and a girl who was like me would make some really cool machines and totally forget to pay all our bills.

name: deimosrising
text: The ongoing alt-text writer saga is one of the more perplexing to me. Is it a joke? Were there really alt-text writers? Who knows man. Who knows.

name: idsyen
text: I'm pretty sure he pulls that out when he can't think of anything for the alt-text.

name: suprememongoose
text: I love that the 1982 Subaru Brat is the official ride in hell. Excellent.

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: somebody around the corner from me is actually selling a 1982 Subaru Brat in Lavender, and they have been trying to sell this car for 3 years. It's hard to sell the official car of hell.

name: snowman
text: BUY IT

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes, buy it...then drive it around the country, leaving it parked in a busy lot in a different town each day.  Make sure you have a KFC bucket in the passenger seat.  When you return to the car at the end of day, ready to move on to the next town, see how many "NOTICE THAT YOUR CAR IS FRIKKING AWESOME/where'd you get" slips you accumulate throughout your journey.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: this is an excellent idea.

name: judahnielsen
text: I love that beef is wiping his mouth in the last panel.

name: canusdivinus
text: I love how pissed off he looks. Like he was expecting Hell to be a bit better, or something?

name: usversusthem
text: man you try getting electrocuted by puking on a socket i bet it just sucks all to hell

name: cpnglxynchos
text: maha...someone lamed you for that horrible pun.

name: chaesar
text: I love how, despite that Rose picked up on the fact that Ray sold his soul for piano skills for which to impress the ladies with, she didn't know what a Tofutti-Cutie is because she works the phones for Butterball.

name: jamers
text: How many friends you know that'll go straight to Hell for you? Beef is hella tight with his socket invasive vomet.

name: 1000hz
text: I guess it was the making hot lunches in Ray's dumbwaiter that made Beef's afterlife residency change from Heaven to Hell.

name: gormster
text: I think it's because he committed suicide, dude.

name: killerlimpet
text: A comment left by killerlimpet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, cailetshadow, Doc_Rostov)

name: cdtm
text: On his fourth death, Roast Beef finally gets to kill himself, instead of just getting offed by circumstances...

name: cdl146
text: I was wondering why he ended up in hell this time but not the others. That makes a bit of sense.

name: deusoma
text: Oooooh, and Blister did say that you can't kill yourself to get to Heaven. Guess he was serious.

name: tekende
text:
It is a usual Catholic belief. I think the theory goes that if you kill yourself, you can't then repent and ask forgiveness for that final sin. Therefore you go to Hell.

I think that is how it goes. I could be wrong.

name: mattylite
text: There's only one way to find out...

name: jonmw
text:
Well, if you set things in motion that will result in your eventual definite death, then I think you should be able to repent for that act before it comes to fruition.
Hmm. How long does a death pill (cyanide, given to secret agents) take, and how long do you think it would take to repent for the act of swallowing it?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: twice the time it would take to take effect.

name: cheeks_jd
text: Wouldn't they call Roast Beef his 'real' name in hell?

name: dovey
text: The guys in Hell aren't worried about making things any more painful for Beef in hell. Dude's from Circumstances.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: all asterisk by his name, all meaning hey, go easy on this guy.

name: mikebox
text: Normally, this wouldn't work, but with the Cuervo, it has to.

name: waldo913
text: Yes.  Cuervo has special conductive properties.

name: lamewad
text: I'm not even a vegan (meat is actually a staple in my diet), however, I am a huge fan of Tofutti-Cuties. They are deliciously guilt-free.

name: rowboat
text: I don't usually do this - in fact, it annoys me when people do - but I'm giving you a chubby solely on the power of your avatar.

name: lamewad
text:
Hey, thanks!
Scrubs owns my life. Zach Braff and I are married... he just doesn't know it yet.

name: rowboat
text: Dude! Why'd you have ta go and tell me it's Zack Braff? I thought it was just the world's tallest doctor. You know, like, from somewhere. An actual, tall-ass doctor. Why'd you have ta tell me?

name: lamewad
text:
Sorry mang! Whatchu got against Zach anyhow?
Was it really worth the lame?
=(

name: rowboat
text: I did not lame you. I dislike him, not you. That wasn't me.

name: lamewad
text:
Oh, okay.
Carry on then!

name: heccibiggs
text: Um, it's actually World's Most Giant Doctor. If we're being nitpickety. Which I am.

name: lamewad
text:
Way to be a dick about terms.
^___-

name: tekende
text: World's Most Giant Doctor is a pretty good gag, just barely superior to Dr. Acula and Floating Head Doctor.

name: heccibiggs
text:
You just reminded me of a funny story. When I was with my ex, we used to have a tradtion that around Christmas time we'd have a mini-party with his parents and sister and her boyfriend, and this involved a quiz. One year one of the questions was, "What's the name of the first movie that Zach Braff wrote, directed and starred in?" and my ex went (in total seriousness), "Oh, oh, Dr. Acula!"

Okay it was really funny at the time.

name: boredom_man
text: In his defense, it's easy to confuse a vehicle with a biopic.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it's also the name of a band.

name: i_love_kate
text: I think you'll find that Multi-ethnic Siamese doctor trumps them all.

name: invidious
text:
Sorry, but Scrubs would be 90% shit without John McGinley and Neil Flynn.

I was about to say I have nothing against Zach Braff, but then I realized that my two favorite characters on Scrubs are the two that torment Zach Braff's character.

Eh, probably just a coincidence.

name: boredom_man
text: I have nothing against his character in Scrubs, who is the perfect foil for your aforementioned favorites. If Garden State was any good, I'd have all kinds of anxiety about Braff -- this is a guy who hired an Israeli woman so that he, in his fantasized version of himself, could tell her he wasn't really very Jewish. Fortunately for me, Garden State was the most puerile, self-obsessed, illiterate attempt at extending the author's adolescence since Birth of a Nation , and I need feel no discomfort about fucking hating that motherfucker whatsoever.

name: echidnaboy
text: Roast Beef is a rad friend.

name: laikalost
text: The abruptness of the last panel is really what makes this comic a 5, in my opinion. Ostad's choice to not actually show Beef's death is both artistic and humourous at the same time -- 'adds nicely to the flow, I mean.

name: laikalost
text: The same can be said for the comic featuring Ray's arrival in hell.

name: nabeel84
text: Roast Beef wipes his mouth in hell cause he just threw up in an electric outlet and died.

name: enigmaticforce
text: Anybody else notice the missed opportunity for the gatekeeper of Hell to call Roast Beef by his proper first name?

name: salo
text: Someone sure as hell didn't say that about half a year ago, that's for sure. :)

name: stormagnet
text: I, to, am surprised- I guess there's some sort of professional code here, that goes along with Heaven's showing him consideration in their choice of name plate.

name: charchar
text: Panel 4: The socket was just taunting Beef. Just looking at him like (|.|) Do it, Cassandra, or Rose will know you faaaaailed.

name: canusdivinus
text: Wait. The people in Heaven were decent enough to let him go by Roast Beef, but why are the Hell people? They should be cold giving him the license plate "CASNDRA".

name: thesoulbear
text: I'm not sure about the last panel. If it was Hell, wouldn't they call him Cassandra?

name: thesoulbear
text: Dang, Ninja'd like hell.

name: lolsworth
text: That is what I thought. They are jerks in Hell.

name: paby
text: The Subaru Brat was the worst car ever made.

name: deliciousmuffin
text: Somehow, I thought this entire time that Roast Beef was rolling back and forth on the floor. I don't know why it took me so long to realize it was just the perspective changing.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it's funnier to think about it that way, though.

name: allanpinkerton
text: I always thought that, too.  It just seems like a natural thing for Beef to do while on the phone, like how most people would pace back and forth.  It's probably his depression and the mad slant he's probably got on after his best friend's death.

name: pumpinpedal
text: Fuck, what a painful way to die. Like choking on an electric eel, I guess.

name: gournal
text: Also the eel smells and tastes like vomit, as it chokes and electrocutes you.

name: rocketbunny
text: It's the last panel that does it for me. Beef all showing up to hell, still holding the rag over his mouth... The attention to detail just kills me.
